instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00164: What is 820-00164? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Green light, fan spin, no boot.
threads.message:
Hi, hot an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A board with no visible damage, green light and fan comes on, but no image, chime or boot. Doesn't boot on SMC bypass mode. 

Replaced BIOS chip, no change

<SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>: 1.8v

<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL>: 3.3v

<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>: 3.4v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Green light, fan spin, no boot.
threads.message:
Do you get <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL>?
Did you test the board alone on the desk?
How the fault appeared?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Green light, fan spin, no boot.
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is 3.3v 

User says he was just using it and it shut down.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Green light, fan spin, no boot.
threads.message:
Did you test USB activity on both ports?
Check all voltages from page 11.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Green light, fan spin, no boot.
threads.message:
Yes, USB ports have power. 

All voltages from page 11 present.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Green light, fan spin, no boot.
threads.message:
"USB ports have power"
I didn't ask that.
You have sufficient time in the forum, to know how to check for USB ACTIVITY (not power).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Green light, fan spin, no boot.
threads.message:
Yes, im sorry. 

It has USB activity.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Green light, fan spin, no boot.
threads.message:
Then the board boots.

Check for external video.
If needed, force it disconnecting internal LCD.
